intro: Hieracium armerioides, commonly known as the lesser wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Hieracium armerioides is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
